meanings.definition: A rigid structure that surrounds or encloses something.
meanings.sent1: The artist used wooden frames to display her paintings at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The window frames in the house were painted white.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a cozy spot within the frames of the tree branches.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed within the frames of the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The frames of the glasses were delicate and intricate.

meanings.definition: A single image in a series of images that make up a motion picture or television show.
meanings.sent1: The action movie had intense frames of car chases and explosions.
meanings.sent2: The frames of the film were carefully edited to create a seamless story.
meanings.sent3: The funny scene in the movie had everyone laughing at the frames on screen.
meanings.sent4: The frames of the horror movie left a lasting impression on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The frames of the documentary captured the beauty of nature perfectly.

meanings.definition: To construct or formulate in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She frames her arguments with strong evidence to convince others.
meanings.sent2: The architect framed the building plans with precision and care.
meanings.sent3: He framed his apology in a way that made it hard to refuse.
meanings.sent4: The chef framed the dish beautifully with colorful garnishes.
meanings.sent5: The author framed the story in a captivating narrative style.
